intro: Gladiolus izzet-baysalii, commonly known as the Izet-Baysal gladiolus, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tall spikes of colorful flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing showy, sword-shaped petals in shades of red, pink, and white. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens with adequate space. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for botanical conservation efforts.
